docs.snippet: A British exit from the European Union could trigger similar moves by other member states in Eastern Europe, Luxembourg Foreign Minister Jean Asselborn said in a German newspaper interview published on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: A British exit from the European Union could trigger similar moves by other member states in Eastern Europe, Luxembourg Foreign Minister Jean Asselborn said in a German newspaper interview published on Sunday.

headline.main: Brexit Could Have Domino Effect in Eastern Europe: Luxembourg's Asselborn
headline.print_headline: Brexit Could Have Domino Effect in Eastern Europe: Luxembourg's Asselborn

docs.snippet: Jeffrey Gundlach, chief executive officer of DoubleLine Capital, said on Friday he thinks Britain will "Bremain" in the European Union and if investors agree they should buy beaten-down European equities....
docs.lead_paragraph: Jeffrey Gundlach, chief executive officer of DoubleLine Capital, said on Friday he thinks Britain will "Bremain" in the European Union and if investors agree they should buy beaten-down European equities.

headline.main: DoubleLine's Gundlach Sees Bremain, Not Brexit, as Likely Outcome
headline.print_headline: DoubleLine's Gundlach Sees Bremain, Not Brexit, as Likely Outcome

docs.snippet: European Central Bank governing council member Ewald Nowotny said a British exit, or Brexit, from the European Union after a referendum on June 23 would hurt the 'City of London', as businesses would move to financial centers in the EU....
docs.lead_paragraph: European Central Bank governing council member Ewald Nowotny said a British exit, or Brexit, from the European Union after a referendum on June 23 would hurt the 'City of London', as businesses would move to financial centers in the EU.

headline.main: ECB's Nowotny-Brexit Would Hurt Financial Business in London
headline.print_headline: ECB's Nowotny-Brexit Would Hurt Financial Business in London

docs.snippet: The policy chief of Japan's ruling party said on Wednesday that she would closely watch the outcome of the British referendum next week on whether to exit the European Union and that the Japanese government should respond if it results in disorder...
docs.lead_paragraph: The policy chief of Japan's ruling party said on Wednesday that she would closely watch the outcome of the British referendum next week on whether to exit the European Union and that the Japanese government should respond if it results in disorderly moves in currency markets.

headline.main: Japan LDP Policy Chief to Closely Watch Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: Japan LDP Policy Chief to Closely Watch Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: Central banks around the globe are preparing financial backstops to mitigate market turmoil in case Britons vote next week to leave the European Union, hoping to buffer the real economy from any short-term impact....
docs.lead_paragraph: Central banks around the globe are preparing financial backstops to mitigate market turmoil in case Britons vote next week to leave the European Union, hoping to buffer the real economy from any short-term impact.

headline.main: Global Central Banks Prepare Swap Facilities for Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: Global Central Banks Prepare Swap Facilities for Brexit Vote

docs.snippet: European shares fell for a fifth straight session on Tuesday on angst over next week's referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union and uncertainty over the outcome of a two-day U.S. Federal Reserve meeting that starts later in the day...
docs.lead_paragraph: European shares fell for a fifth straight session on Tuesday on angst over next week's referendum on Britain's membership of the European Union and uncertainty over the outcome of a two-day U.S. Federal Reserve meeting that starts later in the day.

headline.main: Brexit Fears Send European Shares to Lowest Since February
headline.print_headline: Brexit Fears Send European Shares to Lowest Since February

docs.snippet: Britons still undecided on how they will vote in a referendum on EU membership think they would be 71 pounds ($103) a year worse off if Britain quits the bloc, a survey said, suggesting the "Leave" camp faces a bigger challenge than the "Remain" s...
docs.lead_paragraph: Britons still undecided on how they will vote in a referendum on EU membership think they would be 71 pounds ($103) a year worse off if Britain quits the bloc, a survey said, suggesting the "Leave" camp faces a bigger challenge than the "Remain" side.

headline.main: Undecided Voters See Brexit Making Them Worse Off: Survey
headline.print_headline: Undecided Voters See Brexit Making Them Worse Off: Survey

docs.snippet: Nine out of 10 of Britain's top economists working in London's City financial district, small business and academia believe the economy will be harmed if Britain leaves the European Union, a poll said on Sunday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Nine out of 10 of Britain's top economists working in London's City financial district, small business and academia believe the economy will be harmed if Britain leaves the European Union, a poll said on Sunday.

headline.main: Most Economists Say Brexit Will Harm Economy-Poll
headline.print_headline: Most Economists Say Brexit Will Harm Economy-Poll

docs.snippet: As farmer Guy Poskitt looks across a field of pumpkin seedlings, he worries how he will get them planted and picked in future if Britain votes next month to leave the European Union and closes the door on migrant workers....
docs.lead_paragraph: As farmer Guy Poskitt looks across a field of pumpkin seedlings, he worries how he will get them planted and picked in future if Britain votes next month to leave the European Union and closes the door on migrant workers.

headline.main: Who Will Pick the Carrots if Brexit Stops Migration?
headline.print_headline: Who Will Pick the Carrots if Brexit Stops Migration?

docs.snippet: Credit Suisse chairman Urs Rohner said on Tuesday that he would expect to see more volatility closer to a vote in Britain on whether or not to stay in the European Union....
docs.lead_paragraph: Credit Suisse chairman Urs Rohner said on Tuesday that he would expect to see more volatility closer to a vote in Britain on whether or not to stay in the European Union.

headline.main: Credit Suisse's Rohner Says Expects Volatility Close to Brexit Vote
headline.print_headline: Credit Suisse's Rohner Says Expects Volatility Close to Brexit Vote
